title: Burndown Metrics and Historical Tracking
body:
## Problem

There is no historical data about ticket throughput. Users cannot see how many tickets were completed over time, velocity trends, or burndown progress for any project.

## Solution

Track ticket state transitions over time and surface burndown/velocity metrics in the dashboard.

### Data model

Store a lightweight event log per project at `.cortex/metrics.jsonl` (append-only):

```jsonl
{"ts":"2026-01-27T10:00:00Z","event":"created","ticket_id":"abc","title":"Fix bug"}
{"ts":"2026-01-27T11:00:00Z","event":"moved","ticket_id":"abc","from":"backlog","to":"progress"}
{"ts":"2026-01-27T14:00:00Z","event":"moved","ticket_id":"abc","from":"progress","to":"done"}
```

### Dashboard integration

Add a stats/metrics panel to the dashboard (or per-project drill-down):

- Tickets completed today / this week
- Average time from backlog → done
- Simple ASCII burndown chart (backlog count over time)

## Dependencies

- Daemon Dashboard TUI

## Scope

- Event logging: append to `.cortex/metrics.jsonl` on every ticket state transition
- Metrics computation: parse event log for burndown, velocity, cycle time
- Dashboard panel: display key stats per project
- Keep it lightweight — JSONL append-only, no database

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Ticket state transitions are logged to `.cortex/metrics.jsonl`
- [ ] Dashboard shows tickets completed today/this week per project
- [ ] Average cycle time (backlog → done) is computed and displayed
- [ ] Data persists across daemon restarts (file-based)
